title: Meiji Yasuda’s Paper Bond Losses Jump Eightfold as Rates Climb
content: Four of Japan’s biggest life insurers reported that unrealized losses on their domestic bond holdings last fiscal year reached about $60 billion in total, underscoring the risks they face as interest rates climb.

title: European Stocks Rally as Trump Extends Deadline for EU Tariffs
content: European stocks gained after President Donald Trump said he would extend the deadline for the region to face higher tariffs, as investors weigh the prospects for a longer-term trade deal.

title: Stocks Rise on Trump’s Tariff Delay; Dollar Slides: Markets Wrap
content: European stocks climbed along with US equity futures after President Donald Trump extended a deadline on aggressive euro area tariffs. A gauge of the dollar headed for its lowest level in almost two years.

title: European Gas Rises Amid Supply Cuts at Norway’s Troll Field
content: European natural gas prices extended gains after unplanned capacity cuts were announced at Norway’s giant Troll field, further curbing flows from the region’s top supplier.

title: South Africa Invites Trump to Explore Business Opportunities
content: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa said the nation invited his US counterpart to send officials to the country to “explore opportunities for deepening investment and trade.”

title: European Solar Profits Tumble to Record Low on Long Sunny Spring
content: Profits at Europe’s solar parks have sunk to record lows, raising concerns that the more the industry expands, the farther prices will fall.

title: EU Tariff Deadline; Trump Weighs Russia Sanctions | Horizons Middle East & Africa 05/26/2025
content: US President Donald Trump saying he's extending the deadline for the EU to face 50% tariffs until July 9. Also on the show: Trump says he is considering new sanctions against Russia; US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent expects several large trade deals to be announced in the coming weeks; Southeast Asian leaders start two days of talks in Kuala Lumpur; Trump's pivot on Africa; Trump has announced what he calls a "planned partnership" between US Steel and Japan's Nippon Steel. Guests include: Ben Powell, Blackrock Investment Institute, Chief Middle East & APAC Investment Strategist; Zeina Rizk, Amwal Capital Partners, Fixed Income Partner and Co-Head. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Japan’s Stocks Solid as Trump Rhetoric Cools; Nippon Steel Gains

title: Chinese EV Stocks Tumble After BYD Slashes Prices Up to 35%
content: BYD Co. led Chinese electric vehicle stocks lower in Hong Kong on Monday, as investors digested the auto giant’s sweeping price cuts of as much as 34% late last week.

title: Shipping Bottlenecks in Europe Send a Warning to US, Asia
content: Port congestion is worsening at key gateways in northern Europe and other hubs, according to a new report which suggests trade wars could spread maritime disruptions to Asia and the US and push up shipping rates.

title: Insight with Haslinda Amin 5/26/2025

content: “Bloomberg: The China Show” is your definitive source for news and analysis on the world's second-biggest economy. title: Oil Steadies as Traders Weigh Trump’s Tariff Pledge on EU Goods
content: Oil was steady as the market weighed the outlook for easing trade tensions after President Donald Trump said he would extend the deadline for the European Union to face so-called reciprocal tariffs.

title: GMO Group Scraps $2 Billion Share Sale Plan of Internet Unit
content: The Japanese conglomerate GMO Internet Group Inc. canceled a planned share offering of one of its listed arms after the stock surged in recent months, pushing up the unit’s valuation.

title: Dollar Extends Drop as EU Tariff Delay Boosts Risk-Sensitive FX
content: A gauge of the dollar slid toward its lowest level in nearly two years after US President Donald Trump’s decision to postpone higher tariffs on the European Union boosted other currencies with strong links to global trade.

title: Emerging Currencies Advance as Trump Extends EU Tariff Deadline
content: A gauge of emerging-market currencies rallied to a record high as Washington’s decision to extend the deadline for aggressive tariffs on the European Union bolstered risk appetite.

title: 'Stars Align' For Emerging Markets: Morgan Stanley
content: Amy Oldenburg, the Head of Emerging Markets Equity for Morgan Stanley Investment Management, speaks on Bloomberg's Insight with Haslinda Amin about investment opportunities in emerging markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Goldman Sachs Expects Stronger Yuan to Boost Chinese Stocks
content: Chinese stocks are expected to benefit from further gains in the yuan, which has been showing resilience amid the country’s trade spat with the US, according to strategists at Goldman Sachs Group Inc.

title: Bloomberg: The Asia Trade 05/26/2025
content: "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade" brings you everything you need to know to get ahead as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Sydney with Paul Allen and Haidi Stroud-Watts, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping global markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Fed's Kashkari Says Shock of Tariffs Is 'Stagflationary'
content: Federal Reserve Bank of Minneapolis President Neel Kashkari says "there's no question the shock of tariffs is stagflationary," adding that the magnitude depends on the rate of the trade levies and time period involved. Kashkari speaks with Haslinda Amin on Bloomberg Television.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Indian Stocks May Benefit From Weak US Dollar, Delayed EU Tariffs

content: The Philippine peso rose to its strongest level in almost two years against the dollar, buoyed by weakness in the US currency and oil prices.

title: WiseTech Buys E2Open for $2.1 Billion in Its Biggest Deal
content: Australian shipping software company WiseTech Global Ltd. made its biggest ever acquisition, agreeing to buy E2open Parent Holdings Inc. in a deal that values the US firm at $2.1 billion.

title: Thai FM Calls for Joining Global Supply Chains

title: Japan’s Stocks Solid as Trump Rhetoric Cools; Nippon Steel Gains

title: Multiple People Taken to Hospitals After Shooting Incident in South Carolina Beach Town

title: Macron Vows Closer Defense, Energy Ties in Visit to Vietnam
content: French President Emmanuel Macron vowed closer cooperation on defense, transport and nuclear energy after talks with Vietnam’s leaders as he kicked off a tour of Southeast Asia aimed at shoring up alliances in the region.

title: Trump Optimistic on Iran Deal After ‘Very Good’ Rome Talks

title: Japan to Sell Rice Stockpiles With Aim to Halve Soaring Prices
content: Japan will sell additional stockpiles of rice at a fixed price with an aim to halve soaring costs, newly-appointed agriculture minister Shinjiro Koizumi said as the country heads toward a summer election.

title: US Risks Losing ‘Reliable Investment’ Status, Allianz GI Manager Says
content: Inside one of Europe’s biggest asset managers, there’s growing concern that Republican efforts to gut legislation supporting key industries such as clean energy may result in the US losing its status as a destination for investor capital.

title: Japan Touts Ships Expertise, LNG Project as Tariff Talks Key

title: Maduro Sweeps Venezuelan Regional Vote Marked by Low Turnout

title: Israeli Military Aims to Take Over 75% of Gaza in Two Months
content: Israel’s military push in Gaza aims to take over 75% of the small coastal strip within two months, containing some 2 million people into three areas, according to Israeli media accounts of a military briefing on Sunday.

title: Romania’s New Math Whiz President Faces Tough Budget Arithmetic
content: The ballot numbers added up for Romania’s Nicusor Dan, the one-time math prodigy who defeated a formidable far-right challenger to win the Black Sea nation’s presidency this month.

title: Tusk Plan to Change Poland Turns on Knife-Edge Presidential Vote
content: Poland’s two presidential candidates are heading into the final week of a neck-and-neck election campaign that risks leaving Prime Minister Donald Tusk boxed in by a nationalist rival.

title: China’s Ambassador Warns Australia Over Port of Darwin Lease
content: China’s ambassador to Australia has warned Canberra to be careful in its handling of the lease of a strategically important port, after Prime Minister Anthony Albanese pledged to bring it back into his country’s hands.

title: Malaysia’s Anwar Writes Trump Seeking Summit With Southeast Asia
content: Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim said he personally wrote to Donald Trump seeking to organize a meeting with Southeast Asian nations amid concerns over the US president’s proposed tariff hikes.

title: Israel's Latest Strikes in Gaza Kill 38 People Including Children
content: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — Israeli strikes over the past 24 hours killed at least 38 people in Gaza, including children, local health officials said Sunday, with no data available for a second straight day from now-inaccessible hospitals in the north.

content: Elected lawmakers in Canada’s governing Liberal Party voted against adopting a mechanism that would have given them more power to oust Prime Minister Mark Carney as party leader in the future.

content: Supporters of Poland’s presidential contenders took to the streets of Warsaw on Sunday for parallel marches that highlight deep divisions in the European Union nation a week before a tightly-contested runoff election.

title: Rayner Leaves Door Open on Benefit Reform as Farage Ups Pressure
content: UK Deputy Prime Minister Angela Rayner left the door open on whether the government will lift the two-child benefit cap even as Nigel Farage’s Reform UK seeks to outflank the ruling Labour Party in bringing down the cost of living.

content: Australia’s two center-right opposition parties appear to be on track to return to the Coalition, a longstanding alliance between the pair that suffered a surprise split last week in the wake of a disastrous election showing.

title: Polish Ruling-Party Candidate Pushes Back Against Far Right
content: Warsaw Mayor Rafal Trzaskowski, who narrowly won the first round of Poland’s presidential election, is pushing back against the far right ahead of his runoff with opposition candidate Karol Nawrocki on June 1.

title: Bloomberg Daybreak: Europe 05/26/2025
content:
Bloomberg Daybreak Europe is your essential morning viewing to stay ahead. Live from London, we set the agenda for your day, catching you up with overnight markets news from the US and Asia. And we'll tell you what matters for investors in Europe, giving you insight before trading begins.

On today's show, US President Trump says he will pause his 50% tariffs on the European Union until July 9th after speaking with Commission President Ursula von der Leyen. The move allows for more time to negotiate a trade deal between Washington and Brussels.

Meanwhile, President Trump says he is considering new sanctions against Russia, after Moscow launched a second night of deadly missile and drone strikes across much of Ukraine. Trump's comments come as he appears to grow frustrated with Russian President Vladimir Putin, with ceasefire efforts losing momentum. (Source: Bloomberg)
